message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.DB. 

The paper deals with privacy-preserving data release and differential privacy, which are common topics in the sub-category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR). The use of matrix mechanisms and linear counting queries suggests that the paper may also fall under the sub-category of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS). The investigation of what makes a set of queries "easy" or "hard" to answer and the consideration of error reduction techniques are relevant to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). The use of noise addition and the consideration of error bounds are also relevant to the sub-category of Information Theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper deals with synthetic data generation, which is a common topic in the sub-category of Databases (cs.DB).
